form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to modify the transportation finance infrastructure and innovation program with respect to community development financial institutions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Equitable Transit Oriented Development Support Act.

subsection.header: Community development financial institution transit-Oriented development

paragraph.text: Chapter 6 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Community development financial institution transit-oriented development

paragraph.text: The term CDFI TOD project means a project located within one-half mile in an urban area or three-fourths of a mile in a rural area of a fixed guideway transit facility, passenger rail station, intercity bus station or intermodal facility that supports—

subparagraph.text: commercial facilities or businesses that are located in low-income communities and are—

clause.text: owned by low-income persons;
principally serve low-income persons or low-income community residents; or
principally employ low-income persons;

subparagraph.text: community facilities that are located in low-income communities or principally serve low-income persons; or
housing that is principally affordable to low-income persons.

paragraph.text: The term Investment Area has the meaning given the term in section 1805.201(b)(3)(B)(ii) of title 12, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this section).

The term loan means any form of direct financial assistance that is required to be repaid over a period of time provided by a CDFI to a project sponsor for all or part of the costs of a CDFI TOD project.
The term low-income community means a community that is located in an Investment Area.

The term low-income person means a person whose income does not exceed the level established for low-income (as such term is defined in section 1805.104 of title 12, Code of Federal Regulations, as in effect on the date of enactment of this section).
The term project sponsor means a public or private entity approved by a CDFI and developing a CDFI TOD project in accordance with this section.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall enter into a memorandum of understanding with the Secretary of Treasury to support consultation with the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund to provide the necessary credit underwriting, servicing, and monitoring of CDFI applicants and participants in the TIFIA program.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall require any CDFI participating in the program authorized in this section to establish a CDFI TOD account into which the proceeds of a secured loan made to the CDFI in accordance with sections 602 and 603 and any loan repayments from public or private entities receiving loans made to fund CDFI TOD projects will be deposited.
Any principal loan repayments and any investment income derived from funds deposited to a CDFI TOD account shall be—

subparagraph.text: credited to the account;
available for providing loans to project sponsors;
available for repaying the secured loan made to the CDFI in accordance with sections 602 and 603; and
invested in such financing instruments as the Secretary may approve to earn interest to augment the lending capacity of the account.

paragraph.text: Any loan to a project sponsor funded from the account shall—

subparagraph.text: be in an amount determined by the CDFI, but in any case not exceed 80 percent of eligible project costs;
commence repayment not later than 5 years after the project has been completed;
have a final maturity not later than 30 years after the date of the first payment on the loan;
be set at a rate not greater than the level needed to fully reimburse the CDFI’s administrative, monitoring, servicing, and capital charges associated with the loan; and
be secured and have a priority of payment as determined by the CDFI.

paragraph.text: The CDFI may apply loan repayments to fund additional loans provided such relending does not impair the ability of the CDFI to repay its secured loan in full and timely fashion.

The CDFI is authorized to provide loans for CDFI TOD projects under a delegated lending model. No provision of this section shall restrict the ability of the CDFI to establish the terms and conditions of loans to project sponsors under this section.

subsection.text: If the Secretary determines that a CDFI is not implementing the CDFI TOD account in accordance with the application of such account, the Secretary may prohibit the CDFI from drawing down any additional proceeds from a secured loan commitment.

subsection.header: Forms of assistance from a CDFI

paragraph.text: A CDFI may, using funds deposited into the CDFI TOD account, make loans to a public or private entity to carry out a CDFI TOD project.
The amount of a loan or other form of credit assistance provided for a project described in subsection (c)(3) may be subordinated to any other debt financing for the project.

subsection.text: Any CDFI participating in this program shall make an annual report to the Secretary not later than September 30 of each year and such other reports as the Secretary may require under guidelines issued to carry out this section.

The requirements of this title and title 49 that would otherwise apply to funds made available under this chapter or such title and projects assisted with those funds shall apply to CDFI TOD projects assisted by the CDFI under this chapter, except to the extent the Secretary determines that any requirement of such title is not applicable or is not consistent with the objectives of this section.

The deposit of Federal funds into a CDFI under this section shall not be construed as a commitment, guarantee, or obligation on the part of the United States to any third party, nor shall any third party have any right against the United States for payment solely by virtue of the contribution. Any security or debt financing instrument issued by the CDFI shall expressly state that the security or instrument does not constitute a commitment, guarantee, or obligation of the United States.

For each fiscal year, a CDFI may not expend more than 2 percent of the Federal assistance received under this chapter to pay the reasonable costs of administering a CDFI TOD account pursuant to this section.
